caption.p: Elements to address in pre-travel consultation, incorporating assessment for risk for COVID-19

tr.th: Description of risk factors and characteristics to assess

tr.td: Underlying diseases including cardiac, diabetes mellitus, obesity, hypertension, renal failure and respiratory conditions
How much risk is individual willing to accept for this trip
How important is this trip (e.g. wedding, graduation, professional meeting, job interview, vacation)
If and when appropriate scientific evidence and adequate tests become available to substantiate the premise that prior infection (or antibody presence) can confer immunity for this trip’s timeframe

Exceptional vulnerability evident, confined space, passenger density, co-mingling onboard and sampling of multiple ports with different disease patterns (requires additional detailed and specific advice)
Size, seating configuration and density of seats, commitment of airline to cleaning, use of high frequency particulate air filters, frequency of filter change and air exchanges/hour
Origin and destination airports or more, size, volume of traffic, time spent in airports, potential to have to stay in ‘in-transit’ destination/country for prolonged period
Size, seating configuration and density of seats, commitment of airline to cleaning, use of high frequency particulate air filters, frequency of filter change and air exchanges/hour
Socioeconomic status, healthcare facilities, public health infrastructure, surveillance for infections and current level of circulation of coronavirus
Hotel, home, city, rural and standards for disinfecting/reduce density/physical distancing
Outdoor, indoor; presence of large crowds/nature of crowds e.g. local vs international from high-transmission countries, and numbers involved, proximity and duration of close contact; season of year
Adequacy of services, capacity and service for foreigners
Public health infrastructure at destination (overlaps with destination country element)
Testing ability and appropriate detection of local cases/quarantine/isolation
Component 3: Policies including health insurance, employer mandate and government regulations (origin and destination)
Coverage for delays, cancellations and healthcare need abroad
Requirement for mandatory quarantine on arrival
Requirement for mask wearing or face covering
Requirement for mandatory quarantine upon return
